bestReview: The French professor is very cute and looks very cute A layman who is slightly interested in architecture can easily get the turtle

Ok Why is no one commenting here Then I come here it seems that every semester is different It’s just for reference The studio people live in the beginning of Knowles Hall not Sixty or seventy people are randomly divided into four groups and assigned to four teachers to do a workshop for three or four weeks and then rotate The content of the four workshops in one semester will be slightly different Lilys theme is ground conditions and sawing battens Everyone cooperates to make a topographic model of North Hong Kong Island without buildings but with foundation depth Each person also makes several small site clay models Haotian’s four workshops are different There are those who look for city mirrors those who build streetscapes with dislocations those who express shadows and those who make drawing machines I don’t know the specific content of each workshop and the description may be wrong orz The one that feels more abstract is Wataru To build a building is really to build a building When the model is finally destroyed it is very exciting for Evelyn to make a plaster model Using plaster to represent the space seems to be different for each group Arouse interest and learn basic operations In this semester I dabbled in rhino AutoCAD and other software I also learned to use tools such as foamcutter jigsaw to make models and learned handdrawn architectural drawings The two reviews in this semester are all based on workshops The oneperson defense seems to be individual in the previous semester and the portfolio overturned at the end without experience The result is like the manual If you want a good turtle you can refer to the master’s portfolio how to do it and ask the seniors Don’t go my old way wry smile

bestReview: Originally because of the portal I couldn’t choose other common cores so I randomly chose this newly opened CC but after taking the class I found that the professor was full of surprises In the class he mainly discussed Hong Kong’s ghost stories and urban legends In one class he mainly talked about Hong Kong Ghost Stories from Dahe University this course is strongly recommended for students who are interested in suspenseurban vividness especially students in Y1 to take this course in Y1 The class also invited local live hosts to give lectures at the school but unfortunately because of the epidemic There are only 10 or so people in the classroom Tutor Eugene is very good I will give you some advice on homework to do well I personally think that after reading the lecture slides in the reflective journal I can write a free form essay There are two free form essays that can be filmeddesign posters The workload is the same as a 1000word essay Both times I will go to the field trip once to Huangpu and the other time to go to a building or place with urban legends on campus to do a field trip There is a team selection required for the video Teammate I was lucky I was in the same group as non local It took half a day to write the manuscript and half a day to finish the shooting part It took about a day to edit the film Overall the workload is not too big Finally I got a B The same group shot The team members all get B or B but I heard from my friend in the dormitory that they got C so individual assignments especially essays are very important

bestReview: Prose class the content is the ancient classical Chinese texts and the overall development history Although it is an elementary class it has a lot of content Before each class you need to read about 24 classical Chinese texts It is not easy to fully understand the meaning and grasp the characteristics of writing Scoring is for exams tutorial speeches and group reports There is no essay and exams account for a large proportion It is not easy to review because the lectures in class are too substantial and the test will not give you the original text of the article To get a high score you must first memorize the original text very well I vaguely remember that this course consumed at least two notebooks The final score is okay The overall score I learned is basically proportional to the effort but the effort required for A range is really greater than other Chinese courses It is recommended that students who have a good foundation in classical Chinese and are willing to work hard on classical Chinese read it

bestReview: The content of the lecture is the basic time series including the two cluster models of ARIMA and GARCH as well as the estimation prediction and test around these models Dr Tse will give you a bunch of excel sheets for estimation but it is recommended that you master a programming language and know how to estimate such as STATA or R python which will be used in group projects This semester due to the online class gp has become an individual project and more than 20 stock indices are given to pick out two models that have been learned for fit and prediction accounting for 20 The assignment is given by the tutor which is relatively harsh and points are often deducted for no reason The finals are all derived from theoretical calculation formulas and no work on data is required A sample final actually the final of the previous year will be provided before the test and about 30 of the question types are very close Since it is a class taught by FBE the content is more practical and a lot of real data practice is interspersed in the lectures The principles are very shallow If you want to delve into the principles and have a good foundation in mathematical statistics it is recommended to go to STAT4601 Except for ass gp gives good visual inspection and the final score is also good

bestReview: Seeing that many people are asking for evaluations on this course I have answered it a few times but I still feel like I should put ric so that everyone can see it It is a new course which was first taught in sem1 It mainly talks about three valuation algorithms comparable preceding and dcf It also talked about some algorithm content in lbo The content of the valuation part is quite similar to that of 3326 and there are some repetitions because I also took 3326 at the same time and I feel that the two sides can be compared when I review it If it is different it focuses on some processes of ma and lbo Then maybe because it is a new class the professors rhythm is not very good and a lot of time was spent on comparable in the early stage which resulted in some buyside content not being finished at the end Also because it is a new class the assignment of wl is very bad the front wl is not big so many assignments such as report prez discussion and two exams are all crowded in bloody nov and dec because my other wl is not small resulting in It was a bit difficult at the end I dont know if the wl allocation will be better this year Both exams are multiplechoice questions I dont know if the format will be changed this year It may be a bit overwhelming but if you review well the multiple choice questions are not difficult for me For gp please find a big boss to take it with you because many people who have practiced in investment banks come to this course and some even get a return offer which is very good resulting in various reports and prez They are also very advanced TA Tommy is really hard to explain his English is really not very good Although the tutorial is not required every week every time the tutorial will come over with a microphone and ask you to answer In the end the overall score is not bad with Arange of course it may also be because of the new class If you want to learn valuation I still recommend 3326 Although it is a volume the content will be much more detailed If you want to understand some of the content of ma and lbo you can take this course but the schools class is definitely far from the actual work and the content learned by 3316 is probably not very deep Another point is that the guest speaker from the investment bank was invited On the contrary this guest lecture gave me a better understanding of the investment bank which is very good Just some personal views and experiences everyone is for reference only

bestReview: 20212022 directed studies done by sem1 The situation of this course is like this In the first six months of each school year the dept will send you an email to tell you the available topics of the 3999 and 4999 teachers You can talk to the teacher first about what this topic is about and see if you are interested What you do pure math is probably to read books and read articles all the time and write a report on all the things you have read at the end of the semester Being able to write what you have read into a coherent complete math story is already a good level that an undergraduate can do Applied math may have more concrete work I dont know much about it I know that the topics I have opened include pde ode neural network analytic number theory Lau finite fields Lau traveling sales problem Zang cluster algebra Lu riemann surfaces Ng real algebraic geometry Hua geometric function theory on the unit disk Mok

wkld is relatively large and there is usually one assignment per week but the topics are not difficult because similar topics will be discussed on the weekly tutorial and you can just follow the gourd when you are doing your homework The more important pre is 2211 divergence theorem will be used from time to time 3405 will mainly be used to solve the knowledge of 1st order differential equation linear algebra requirements are not high and 2102 is fine Generally speaking it is an easy class If you understand the tutorial you will have no worries about the assignment if you understand the assignment you will have no worries about the test

20212022 on sem1 This course is about the differential geometry of curves and surfaces in R3 The amount of calculation is not bad it is still a little smaller than other 3904 3901 3601 The prerequisite is basically 2101 and 2211 It would be better if you know a little bit of topology and it’s not a big problem if you don’t know wl is slightly larger than other mathematics courses and three to four questions have to be handed in every week hz is very kind in making questions and giving points and the original questions in the textbook often appear in the test and final You must read the teaching materials for this class There are three books in the main picture The teaching materials are very good and there are a lot of exercises Several of our classmates basically finished all the exercises after class I really like Huazhengs lecture style which is not sloppy If you are still interested in the future you can continue to read Riemannian geometry

20212022 on sem1 This course is divided into two parts In the first half of the semester Zhang Xin talked about elliptic functions and the MittagLeffler problem on unit disk There are many practical tips to learn However Zhang Xins lectures are average basically reading lecture notes His exam basically asks you to repeat the proofs that you have taught in class which is relatively simple The second half is about normal families in NTW and it feels like a little bit of geometric function theory added this year I havent learned this before it feels very novel hhh The difficulty of the NTW exam is quite high It is recommended to read more about the textbook called Normal families which will be very helpful The last geometric function theory is basically about Schwarz lemma of Ahlfors There is a lecture note written by Alan Beardon and David Minda on the Internet which is very helpful for this part of the study The end of the course and the second test are not easy It is recommended that you are interested in complex analysis

Transferred from 2017 Xue Haotian Composition Basics if you want to know the basic composition skills look here Course content 1 Some properties of various musical instruments and precautions for these musical instruments when composing For example the lowest note of the violin is G3 If F3 appears in a violin solo written in your project it must be wrong Points will be deducted all kinds of violin scores cannot have two consecutive notes of the same pitch and music that violates the principle cannot be played In addition the performance techniques of various musical instruments are expressed on the score such as the indication of the direction of the violins bow and the indication of the sound of the clarinet This is mainly about rules 2 Some skills of melody line and rhythm arrangement and the balance between the paragraphs of the work can be imagined as paying attention to rhetorical techniques when writing a composition how to write sentences more beautifully and how to communicate between paragraphs This talk is mainly about the habits and skills of composing 3 Look at some examples of composers and learn these rules and techniques About the assessment 10 of the essay includes 5 of the onepage concert review and 5 of the course journal 10 of the signature participation 20 of the assignments there are about 78 assignments each assignment will involve the writing of several sections and the focus of the test is different 60 of the project includes a 30 solo instrumental piece and a 30 ensemble instrumental piece Both works are required to be at least four minutes long and scores and recordings must be submitted The recommended notation software for projects is Sibelius and Overture Recordings are automatically generated after the notation is completed Overture has a free version and the VST sound plugin is also available for free If you have any questions please contact me The genuine version of Sibelius has a student price and there are many local applications but I have never used it The professor will be more inclined to the application of skills rather than whether your work is good or not this is very important If you just write a popular song it will definitely not work This class is very interesting and challenging and you can learn a lot It is also very fulfilling to have two works of my own in the end Professor Joshua Chan no special comment I think he is pretty good

Transferred from an improvement course of music theory by Xue Haotian in 2017 the pre is the content of the MUSI1023 course on the basis of MUSI1023 it will mainly explain the usage of various most basic outoftone chords Secondary dominant Secondary leading tone altered predominant and the like In addition it will also involve some knowledge about the structure of the sonata form which is extremely important for the entire classical music The difference from MUSI1023 is that this course pays more attention to understanding There are basically no explanations in the lecture notes They are all music examples a large number of music examples and the professor talks about concepts and plays music in class The harmony involved in this course can only cover a lot of classical music fragments and you will hear the works of Bach Mozart Haydn Beethoven Schubert Brahms Chopin and others The two tutors are very powerful one is an independent music critic and the other is very handsome and a composer it seems that he started to teach MUSI3023 lectures in 1617 The most interesting course I learned the most in the Music Department of HKU About the assessment 40 of the assignments in addition to the regular exercises of writing various chords and harmony similar to MUSI1023 add score chord analysis and short answer questions so the assignments are more flexible 20 of the inclass quizzes this is the main factor that widens the gap The time is short and the number of questions is large It is necessary to master the concepts proficiently before completing them and the accuracy is required 20 of the take home test gave three pieces of Mozarts works K545I K333III K421I and analyzed the score from the harmony and structure according to the given questions The score is pretty good Professor Youn Kim is a teacher with MUSI2071

courseName: Introduction to contrapuntal styles and techniques
bestReview: Reposted from the 2017 class Xue Haotian The basics of counterpoint is MUSI2070 course content I don’t want to introduce what is counterpoint here everyone can Baidu This course starts from the most basic counterpoint covering the first counterpoint the second counterpoint the third counterpoint the fourth counterpoint and the fifth counterpoint it seems to be nonsense to teach you how to write Counterpoint melody train horizontal musical thinking ability vertical is chorus horizontal is melody The rules of counterpoint are simple but very difficult to write well You can think of writing counterpoint as solving Sudoku A child who has just learned to solve numbers and reads may often solve mistakes and after making a mistake correcting one mistake will lead to another mistake It seems that there is a steady stream of mistakes and that feeling is also slightly painful of However I really like doing counterpoint quiz because it is very logical and it may be more suitable for science students thinking About the Assessment 20 of the test one mid term and one final test each accounting for 10 the test is not difficult but 80 of the portfolio must be carefully done and the portfolio is to correct all the assignments judged by the usual prof and tutor  and then hand it in so in fact it is basically homework correction There really isnt much workload Professor Daniel Chua Head of the Music Department President of the International Musicological Society He is very nice and humorous and his English is very good In his class he basically doesnt want to look at his mobile phone
